subject: Real Estate
title: The Burj Khalifa Bailout
description: Learn The Burj Khalifa Bailout in one minute.

hook.text: The world's tallest building almost didn't get finished. Dubai ran out of money halfway through.

buildup.text: Construction began in 2004 during Dubai's property boom. The 2,717-foot tower cost $1.5 billion.

discovery.text: When the 2008 crisis hit, Dubai's property market crashed 50%. The emirate couldn't pay its debts.

twist.text: Abu Dhabi bailed out Dubai with $10 billion. In return, the tower was renamed from Burj Dubai to Burj Khalifa.

climax.text: The world's tallest building carries the name of a neighbor's ruler â€” the price of a financial rescue.

punchline.text: The tallest building on Earth is named after a bailout.

quiz.question: Why was the Burj Khalifa renamed from Burj Dubai?
options: Abu Dhabi bailed out Dubai during the financial crisis
